articles.author: JACK JEFFERY
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — An explosion in southern Gaza killed eight Israeli soldiers, the military said Saturday, making it the deadliest attack on Israeli forces in months.The attack, coming more than eight months into a grinding war that shows few signs of ending soon, was likely to fuel new calls for a cease-fire by Israeli protesters.
articles.title: 8 Israeli soldiers killed in southern Gaza in deadliest attack on Israeli forces in months

articles.author: STEVE PEOPLES and JOEY CAPPELLETTI
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — Donald Trump used back-to-back stops Saturday to court Black voters and a conservative group that has been accused of attracting white supremacists as the Republican presidential candidate works to stitch together a coalition of historically divergent interests in battleground Michigan.
articles.title: Trump visits a Black church, addresses a MAGA activist gathering amid swing through pivotal Michigan

articles.author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE and WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — After flying through the night across nine time zones, from southern Italy to Southern California, President Joe Biden is shifting his focus from Russia's challenge of Western unity to raking in big money for his reelection campaign at a Hollywood fundraiser featuring George Clooney and Julia Roberts.
articles.title: Biden goes straight from G7 to Hollywood fundraiser, balancing geopolitics with his reelection bid

articles.author: ISABELLA VOLMERT
articles.description: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — Indiana Republicans rejected Sen. Mike Braun’s choice for lieutenant governor on Saturday, instead nominating a podcasting pastor with far-right views to be his running mate.Braun, who is leaving the Senate, endorsed state Rep.
articles.title: Indiana Republicans upset Mike Braun’s choice for lieutenant governor, backing far-right pick

articles.author: JAMEY KEATEN and AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: OBBÜRGEN, Switzerland (AP) — Dozens of world leaders converged on a Swiss resort Saturday to discuss how to bring peace to war-ravaged Ukraine, though any hopes of a real breakthrough were muted by the absence of Russia.
articles.title: World leaders meet in Switzerland to discuss a Ukraine peace roadmap. Russia is notably absent

articles.author: JILL LAWLESS
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Britain put on a display of birthday pageantry Saturday for King Charles III, a military parade that marked the Princess of Wales ’ first appearance at a public event since her cancer diagnosis early this year.
articles.title: UK royals unite on palace balcony, with Kate back at her first public event since cancer diagnosis

articles.author: HEATHER HOLLINGSWORTH
articles.description: A judge has overturned the conviction of a Missouri woman who was a psychiatric patient when she incriminated herself in a 1980 killing that her attorneys argue was actually committed by a now-discredited police officer.
articles.title: Missouri woman's murder conviction tossed after 43 years. Her lawyers say a police officer did it

articles.author: ELÉONORE HUGHES and GABRIELA SÁ PESSOA
articles.description: SAO PAULO (AP) — Thousands of demonstrators took to the streets of Sao Paulo on Saturday as protests sweep across Brazil in opposition to a bill that would further criminalize abortions. If passed, the law would equate the termination of a pregnancy after 22 weeks with homicide.
articles.title: Outraged Brazilian women stage protests against bill to equate late abortions with homicide

articles.author: EVENS SANON and DÁNICA COTO
articles.description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti (AP) — Haitian leaders have ousted Frantz Elbé, the beleaguered director of Haiti’s National Police, following months of criticism that he wasn’t doing enough to protect officers under assault by gangs.
articles.title: Haitian leaders oust police chief and appoint a new one as gang violence claims officers’ lives

articles.author: HEATHER HOLLINGSWORTH
articles.description: The mailings promised “Life Without Pain!” via stem cell injections or IVs administered in a patient’s own home. The allure was obvious: more than 20% of U.S. adults endure chronic pain.The flyers invited Iowans to free dinners across the state.
articles.title: Some hawking stem cells say they can treat almost anything. They can't
